commands.updatetask¶

Classes¶

UpdateTask

This class handles task updates, allowing users to modify existing tasks and reassign task details.

Module Contents¶

class commands.updatetask.UpdateTask(user_id='', data=[], users=[])[source]¶

This class handles task updates, allowing users to modify existing tasks and reassign task details.

Why: Essential for task management, enabling users to update task properties, including description, deadline, points, and assigned users, to ensure accurate and current task tracking.

How: Common usage examples: 1. UpdateTask.checkTaskID(): Verify if the specified task ID exists in the database. 2. UpdateTask.create_task_input_blocks(): Generate Slack-compatible blocks for user input fields prefilled

with current task data for updating.

  1. UpdateTask.update_task(id, desc, points, deadline, assignee): Update task properties in the database.

base_create_task_block_format[source]¶
greetings = ['Awesome', 'Great', 'Congratulations', 'Well done', "Let's go"][source]¶
payload[source]¶
user_id[source]¶
data[source]¶
users[source]¶
checkTaskID()[source]¶

Validates if a given task ID exists in the database.

Returns:

Boolean indicating whether the task ID exists.

Return type:

bool

Why: Ensures that users can only attempt to update tasks that actually exist. How: Example usage - ` is_valid = task_update.checkTaskID() `

create_task_input_blocks()[source]¶

Creates Slack-compatible input blocks prefilled with current task details for easy updating.

Returns:

List of blocks for task input fields, including description, deadline, points, and assignees.

Return type:

list

Why: Provides users with prefilled input fields, making it easy to update tasks without manually re-entering existing data. How: Example usage - ` input_blocks = task_update.create_task_input_blocks() `

update_task(id, desc, points, deadline, assignee)[source]¶

Updates task properties in the database and returns a success message payload.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – Task ID to be updated.

  • desc (str) – Updated description of the task.

  • points (int) – Updated points for the task.

  • deadline (str) – Updated deadline for the task.

  • assignee (str) – Slack ID of the user assigned to the task.

Returns:

Payload blocks with success message if update is successful.

Return type:

list

Why: Updates ensure task data is current and assigned to the appropriate user, facilitating effective task tracking. How: Example usage - ` response_payload = task_update.update_task(12, "New Description", 3, "2023-12-31", "U67890") `
